Try using driverPath = "Path.GetDirectoryName(Assembly.GetCallingAssembly().Location)" for Chrome, Firefox, Internet Explorer and Edge on Windows 10 version 1803 and earlier Try using driverPath = null (default) for Safari and Edge on Windows 10 version 1809 and later

member.summary: Enum of Browser window size configurations.

member.name: F:AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.WindowSize.Hd
member.summary: HD - 1366 x 768 (cheap laptop) screen size. Most common 'PC' screen size.

member.name: F:AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.WindowSize.Fhd
member.summary: Full HD - 1920 x 1080 screen size. 2nd most common 'PC' screen size.

member.name: F:AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.WindowSize.Maximise
member.summary: Maximise the browser to the full screen.

member.name: F:AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.WindowSize.Unchanged
member.summary: Continue without setting screen size, this may not be consistent.

member.name: F:AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.WindowSize.Maximize
member.summary: Maximize the browser to the full screen.

member.name: F:AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.WindowSize.Custom
member.summary: Customise browser size according to the windowCustomSize configuration.

member.name: F:AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.WindowSize.Qhd
member.summary: Quad HD (aka 1440p) - 2560 x 1440

member.name: F:AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.WindowSize.Uhd
member.summary: Ultra HD-1 (aka 4k) - 3840 x 2160

member.name: T:AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.Logging.ILog
member.summary: Simple interface that represent a logger.

member.name: M:AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.Logging.ILog.Log(AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.Logging.LogLevel,System.Func{System.String},System.Exception,System.Object[])
member.summary: Log a message the specified log level.
member.param: Optional format parameters for the message generated by the messagefunc.
member.returns: true if the message was logged. Otherwise false.
member.remarks: Note to implementers: the message func should not be called if the loglevel is not enabled so as not to incur performance penalties. To check IsEnabled call Log with only LogLevel and check the return value, no event will be written.

member.summary: Initializes a new LibLogException with the specified message.

member.name: M:AlexanderOnTest.NetCoreWebDriverFactory.Logging.LogProviders.LogMessageFormatter.SimulateStructuredLogging(System.Func{System.String},System.Object[])
member.summary: Some logging frameworks support structured logging, such as serilog. This will allow you to add names to structured data in a format string: For example: Log("Log message to {user}", user). This only works with serilog, but as the user of LibLog, you don't know if serilog is actually used. So, this class simulates that. it will replace any text in {curly braces} with an index number. "Log {message} to {user}" would turn into => "Log {0} to {1}". Then the format parameters are handled using regular .net string.Format.
